displaytitle: Bust of a Man facing right
creditline: Bequest of Junius S. Morgan, Class of 1888
markings:
Collector's stamp in brown ink, verso upper center: A.F. von Lanna (Lugt 2773)

Collector's stamp in black ink, verso lower center: Amboise Firmin-Didot (Lugt 199)
inscribed:
Initialed in plate, upper center: HG et

In margin encircling bust, in German: Auf Gott stehet mein vertrauwen. AETATIS.32

Dated in plate below bust, lower center: 1579

titles.title: Bust of a Man facing right

makers.displaydate: 1558–1617; born Mülbracht, Netherlands; died Haarlem, Netherlands
makers.displaymaker: Hendrick Goltzius, 1558–1617; born Mülbracht, Netherlands; died Haarlem, Netherlands

texts.textentryhtml: Ambroise Firmin-Didot [1790-1876, Lugt 119]; sale of his collection, Paris, April 16-May 12, 1877, lot 675; Adalbert von Lanna [1836-1909, Lugt 2773]; sale of his collection, Stuttgart, May 11-22, 1909, lot 1845; Junius S. Morgan [1867-1932]; bequeathed to Princeton University Art Museum, 1932.

bibliography.boilertext: Marjolein Leesberg, "Hendrick Goltzius," New Hollstein Dutch & Flemish etchings, engravings and woodcuts, 1450-1700 (Ouderkerk aan den Ijssel: Sound & Vision Publishers, in co-operation with the Rijksprentenkabinet, Rijksmuseum, Amsterdam, 2012).
